timeline.message: Pull in dependencies for optional interface if already existing
Change some log info to log debug

timeline.bodyText:
There are two relevant cases that should also been tested:
If mdA100, mdA110, mdD100 and mdD110 are available, and mdA100 and mdD100 are enabled.
First case: Enable mdA110 and check that both are upgraded.
Second case: Enable mdD110 and check that both are upgraded.
timeline.author: julianladisch

replies.bodyText:
First case: only mdA110 will be upgraded, because mdD100 can use the provided interface of mdA110.
Second case: both will be upgraded, because mdD110 will require mdA110.
replies.author: adamdickmeiss

timeline.bodyText:
In all these tests there is no need to use Async.
Replace "res -> { context.assertTrue(res.succeeded());" by "context.asyncAssertSuccess(res ->"
and "res -> { context.assertTrue(res.failed());" by "context.asyncAssertFailure(exception ->"
timeline.author: julianladisch

replies.bodyText: Can't do like that, cause AsyncResult != ExtendedAsyncResult. I know one could use a utility or something, but least the async is systematically used.
replies.author: adamdickmeiss

replies.bodyText: That's true and technical dept. https://issues.folio.org/browse/OKAPI-810 "Replace ExtendedAsyncResult by AsyncResult where possible"
replies.author: julianladisch

timeline.bodyText:
Yes, no moduleD upgrade is needed because moduleA's new interface is compatible (int-1.0 -> int-1.1).
Can you add another test where moduleA-1.0.0 is upgraded to moduleA-2.0.0 with int-2.0 and this triggers the moduleD upgrade from moduleD-1.0.0 to moduleD-2.0.0 because moduleD-2.0.0 has optional dependency on int-2.0?
timeline.author: julianladisch

replies.bodyText: Good one. That was a reverse dependency not catched.. Now fixed.
replies.author: adamdickmeiss

timeline.bodyText: ret is not used. Can you remove this variable?
timeline.author: julianladisch
julianladisch
